title: Murder probe launched after pensioner, 90, is found dead in home - police arrest 49-year-old man
text:
A man has been arrested after a 90-year-old man was found murdered in his home.

Police confirmed a 49-year-old man has been taken into custody on suspicion of murder after the pensioner's body was found on Saturday, October 5.

Officers were called at around 8.53am that morning and made the discovery inside a house in Love Lane Terrace, Pontefract, West Yorks.

The suspect was arrested on Sunday after inquiries were made at the scene, detectives said.

Police tape covers the stairway in the block of flats in Love Lane Terrace in Pontefract where the man's body was found

Squad cars remain at the scene as West Yorkshire Police continue their enquiries

The man was arrested on Sunday following the discovery of the body before 9am on Saturday

DCI Heather Whoriskey of West Yorkshire Police said a post mortem was due to be conducted to determine the cause of death.

She added: 'Officers are treating the matter as a murder and arrested a 49-year-old man on suspicion of murder on Sunday.'

MailOnline understands the suspect remains in custody being interviewed by police.
description: A man has been arrested after a 90-year-old man was found dead in his home on Saturday. The 49-year-old was taken into custody on Sunday by West Yorkshire Police.
